results.title: Ken's great times with Legacy
results.creator_credit: Ken Hellnig, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Ken joined Legacy after his dad’s death. He went on the first Legacy camp in his early 20s and he shares with us his years with Legacy, the camps, day trips, boating adventures and the friends made over the years.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Hellnig, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Cherry, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Rebecca has been involved in various capacities in Legacy since her father died when she was seven. Rebecca talks about the different families in her life, especially the one she has found at Legacy. She has gone from being a Rotary Exchange student to a Legacy leader.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rebecca Cherry, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: Families and life
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Shaw, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A letter to her family and future generations, Suzanne tells of her family history, especially of her father and husband in war and how Legacy helped her with her grief and loss and helped her to move forward with her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Suzanne Shaw, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: The Bribe
results.creator_credit: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: It took the bribe of a new phone by her mother to convince Ashlea to go on a Legacy camp. As much as she missed her father, she didn’t want his death to define her. At the camp, Ashlea started to make friends and became a member of Legacy, which she has been a part of ever since.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: Anne's Legacy
results.creator_credit: Dulcie Cedaro, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Encouraged by her daughter, Anne, to get out there and keep busy, Dulcie started to volunteer. Through the volunteer work, Dulcie remembered her time at Legacy when she was 12 and decided to join up again. This restored her quality of life and brought her back in contact with the community that would provide support after Anne died.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dulcie Cedaro, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.description: Encouraged by her daughter, Anne, to get out there and keep busy, Dulcie started to volunteer. results.title: Analysing characters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
Literary characters of James Thurber, Bret Hart and Nathaniel Hawthorne some to life to explain themselves, and appear in dramatisations of famous stories. They rate themselves in terms of development and complexity, and invite judgement of their actions based on each author’s purpose in writing their story.

results.title: How to read plays
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
The suggestions in this film for reading a play emphasise imaginative reconstruction of the stage production, thus enabling the reader to grasp the visual, aural and dramatic content of a play from the written page.
